critique: The document is a simple amendment to an existing executive order, primarily concerning the membership of the National Security Resources Board. It designates various cabinet secretaries as members. There is no clear indication of ideological bias, immigration stance, or social inclusion. The order seems to slightly expand executive power by modifying a previous executive order. It also centralizes power at the federal level by designating cabinet secretaries to a national board. There's no direct impact on security vs. liberty or economic regulation.
